paragraphs.content: I've always been fascinated by robots, and that fascination started with a big adventure - moving from India to Texas to really dive into this world. For the last couple of years, I've been working as a software engineer at day and a robotics enthusiast at night, and I genuinely love figuring out how things work, especially when it comes to unmanned vehicles.

I spend my time working with cool tech like sensors, neural networks, and PyTorch. I really enjoy building the “brains” of robots, figuring out how they see and predict where they're going. I actually get my hands dirty, building things with Nvidia Jetson Xaviers, raspberry pis, and combining data from lidar, cameras, and other sensors.

I was one of the presidents of UTA's AutonoBots club. We tackled some tough challenges, like robot SLAM for unstructured environments, and competed in the National Robotics Challenge (the NRC). I thrive on teamwork and solving real-world problems - I'm up for anything!
When I'm not building robots, you can find me making things - whether it's a game, a robot, or even a song. I also love being outdoors, hitting the trails for a hike or setting up camp.
I'm a doer, always wanting to learn and try new things. Im excited about joining a team where I can use my skills and passion to help build amazing robots and explore new ideas in AI and beyond.
Thanks for taking the time to learn about me and my work. Let's talk!
